title: How to Do Well on the Jeopardy! Test

steps.headline: Register, first and foremost.
steps.description: Go to the official Jeopardy! website and see which tests are open for registration.

steps.headline: When you have obtained your confirmation number, see what time the test will take place.
Log in 15-20 minutes prior to the test.
steps.description: You will need your confirmation number.

steps.headline: Each question is 15 seconds, so manage your time well.
There will be 50 questions, so try to take all 15 seconds of your time.
steps.description: You do not have to give your answers in the form of a question.

steps.headline: If you pass, Jeopardy!
steps.description: will send you an email telling you where to audition.

steps.headline: You will be given another 50 question test.
steps.description: It will work in the same manner as the online test does, except for the fact that you have to write your answers down on a piece of paper.

steps.headline: You will go through mock-trial gameplay.
steps.description: Speak in a loud, clear voice and follow the instructions and advice you're given.

steps.headline: Prepare for a brief interview.
steps.description: You will be asked questions such as "What are your goals in life?" or "What's your favorite novel?" You may also be asked questions based on the answers you gave on the information sheet you were given to fill out before the start of the audition.

text: Test Register, first and foremost. Go to the official Jeopardy! website and see which tests are open for registration. When you have obtained your confirmation number, see what time the test will take place.  Log in 15-20 minutes prior to the test. You will need your confirmation number. Each question is 15 seconds, so manage your time well.  There will be 50 questions, so try to take all 15 seconds of your time. You do not have to give your answers in the form of a question. If you pass, Jeopardy! will send you an email telling you where to audition. Audition You will be given another 50 question test. It will work in the same manner as the online test does, except for the fact that you have to write your answers down on a piece of paper. You will go through mock-trial gameplay. Speak in a loud, clear voice and follow the instructions and advice you're given. Prepare for a brief interview. You will be asked questions such as "What are your goals in life?" or "What's your favorite novel?" You may also be asked questions based on the answers you gave on the information sheet you were given to fill out before the start of the audition.
